targets.expr:
max by(instance, zpool, state) (
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="online"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 2
or
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="offline"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 3
or
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="removed"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 4
or
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="suspended"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 5
or
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="degraded"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 6
or
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="faulted"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 7
or
max without(state) (max_over_time(node_zfs_zpool_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", state="unavail"}[$__interval]) == 1) * 8
)

# max_over_time to get the newest creation date in case pool with the same name was recreated
# using name=~"$pool" selects root dataset of apool, which is always the oldest dataset
$__to / 1000 - min by(instance, pool) (
  max_over_time(zfs_dataset_creation_timestamp{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool", name=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
  or
  # zfs_dataset_creation was used before official support for creation was added
  max_over_time(zfs_dataset_creation{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool", name=~"$pool"}[$__interval])
)

group by(instance, version) (label_replace(last_over_time(zfs_exporter_build_info{instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval]), "version", "<missing>", "version", ""))
or on()
(
  vector(0) unless on() last_over_time(zfs_exporter_build_info{instance=~"$instance"}[$__interval])
)
sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!=""}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path!=""}[$__rate_interval]))

sum by(instance, zpool) (
  # for single-device vdevs get exact value
  rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"disk-.*"}[$__rate_interval])
  or
  # for mirror vdevs get average between leaf vdevs
  avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"mirror-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
  or
  # for raid-z vdevs get avg * (count - 1)
  (
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"raidz1-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
    *
    (-1 + count by(instance, zpool, vdev) (zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"raidz1-.*"}))
  )
  or
  # for raid-z2 vdevs get avg * (count - 2)
  (
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
    *
    (-2 + count by(instance, zpool, vdev) (zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"raidz2-.*"}))
  )
  or
  # for raid-z3 vdevs get avg * (count - 3)
  (
    avg by(instance, zpool, vdev) (rate(zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"raidz3-.*"}[$__rate_interval]))
    *
    (-3 + count by(instance, zpool, vdev) (zfs_vdev_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!="", vdev=~"raidz3-.*"}))
  )
)
-
sum by (instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_pool_scan_issued_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.title: Read (vdev) without scan (approximation, divided by parity coefficient)

options.content:
zfs_exporter for vdevs doesn't have info about l2arc devices,
so vdev read/write speed includes only main disks.

targets.expr: sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_ops{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="read", path!=""}[$__rate_interval]))
sum by(instance, zpool) (rate(zfs_vdev_ops{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", type="write", path!=""}[$__rate_interval]))

panels.description: TRIM is performed per-vdev. This graph is an aggregation that show "the worst" TRIM state across all disks in a pool.

targets.expr:
min by(instance, zpool) (
min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval])
and
(min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == 0)
or
(min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == 1) * 10
)

panels.title: trim state

targets.expr:
sum by(instance, zpool) (
rate(zfs_vdev_trim_processed_bytes{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__rate_interval])
and
(min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_unsupported{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool", path!=""}[$__interval]) == 0)
)

panels.description: Empty, unless trim ran in time range. "calc" is a very rough approximation, it is only correct when you zoom in. If you have a special recording rule, you will also have "record" value which is always correct.

targets.expr:
max by(instance, zpool) (time() - (max_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_action_time{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0))
*
(1 / min by (instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_vdev_trim_active_processed_ratio{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) - 1)

panels.title: trim: estimated remaining time

panels.description: size of the relevant data in the pool when scan was started
panels.title: trim estimated size

targets.expr:
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) > 1)
or
(
group by(instance, zpool) (max_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_scrub_pause{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval]) != 0) + 20
)
or
(
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_func{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) + 10
and
min by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_scan_state{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) <= 1
)
or
group by(instance, zpool) (min_over_time(zfs_pool_config_txg{instance=~"$instance", zpool=~"$pool"}[$__interval])) * 30

options.content:
Scan info is empty for pools
that have never run
scrub or resilver
in their lifetime.

`examined` is about
gathering metadata for scan.

`issued` is actually
reading/writing data.

panels.description: size of the relevant data in the pool when scan was started
panels.title: scan: estimated size

panels.description: Empty, unless scan ran in time range. "calc" is a very rough approximation, it is only correct when you zoom in. If you have a special recording rule, you will also have "record" value which is always correct.
panels.title: scan: issued: estimated remaining time

panels.description: Empty, unless scan ran in time range. "calc" is a very rough approximation, it is only correct when you zoom in. If you have a special recording rule, you will also have "record" value which is always correct.
panels.title: scan: examined: estimated remaining time
